description: Open-access book project on the strategic, ethical and technological renewal of Europe. Version 1.0.2 delivers the complete British English edition and establishes a robust multilingual repository structure (/de, /en) with dedicated pipelines, licensing, citation and publication metadata per language. The GitBook worker has been externalised as a pip-installable package, and a formal translation workflow has been documented. Texts: CC BY-SA 4.0; Code & toolchain: MIT; Fonts: CC BY 4.0 or MIT (dual licence). Full source files (GitBook Markdown), CI/CD configuration and build setup are available in the repository.
notes: Licence matrix: Texts, graphics and diagrams = CC BY-SA 4.0; Code, toolchain and scripts = MIT; self-developed fonts = CC BY 4.0 or MIT (dual licence); emojis = Twemoji (CC BY 4.0). Each language edition is maintained in its own repository folder with dedicated licensing, citation, attribution and publication configuration. CI/CD workflows support parallel multilingual builds.
